Old-timey Surrealist Gifs by Kevin Weir

Posted on November 30, 2014 by Emi T

Hello lovelies.  Today, I thought it was time for something delightfully strange.  I ran across these awesome surreal gifs on Tumblr, thanks to paqosdragons, and thought I’d share them here.  Artist Kevin Weir makes these wonderful gifs from old photographs he gets from the library of congress.  Now this is exactly why I love royalty free archives.  It opens up a world of endless possibilities for really clever and strange delights.

Do you like my top picks?  Check out more of Kevin Weir’s artwork on his main site and his Tumblr blog.  Don’t forget to share your favorites!

Dreamer is Out! Happy 4th Birthday Clockwork Twist!!

Posted on November 17, 2014 by Emi T

The story started 4 years ago today.  7 books have been drafted, and 3 books are already published.  It is so time to party.  That’s right, Book Three is out today!

Get your copy of Clockwork Twist : Dreamer now!

The eBook is on sale for $3.99. Just click the logo of your choice.

 

The paperback is also available, on Amazon.

I’m just so amazed that the story has already come this far.  When I first started writing Waking, I thought I knew a thing or two about publishing and writing, but I really had no idea what I was getting into.  Writing a series is a totally different thing than doing any one-off or a handful of sequels.  At least for right now, Clockwork Twist is the main focus of my life.  And today, 4 years in, I really can’t remember what life was like before I had Twist.  He just popped into my life one day and demanded to be.  Best surprise ever.

Thanks to everyone who has been waiting for this release and sending me such lovely messages of encouragement!  You guys are awesome.  The best part  of this experience for me has to be all of the wonderful, generous, and supportive people I’ve met along the way!  I thought I was just going to write some books.  I never imagined I’d make so many friends because of Twist.

Isn’t that just deliciously ironic?  Twist just thought he was going to go repair a bit of clockwork when he first left London, after all.  Now I think I really know how he feels.

Happy Birthday Clockwork Twist!

Here’s to another year of intrepid adventures, startling discoveries, and unexpected friends.

Pocket Watch Bookmarks!!

Posted on November 8, 2014 by Emi T

Check it out!  I’m on Etsy now.  I just made a handful of bookmarks that look like cute little pocket watches.  There’s only a few designs so far, but there are more to come.  Go take a look at them in my shiny new Esty store.

Best of all, one of them sold before I could even list it!  I was taking photos outside in the light, when one of my neighbors asked what I was up to.  When I showed her my bookmarks, she bought one right then and there as a present for her mother.  Now there are only four of the initial batch left.  If you want one of these, you’d better get it quick!

Not to worry, though.  If these continue to sell well, I’ll just have to keep making more.  I’m also happy to do any sort of custom orders as well.  At the moment, my metal supplies are only of the same brass color, but I hope to branch out and try out some other antiqued metal colors as well.  Let me know in a comment if you have any suggestions.

And, of course, my very next design will be a replica of Twist’s watch from the books…  Keep an eye on this blog and my new store to see it as soon as I get it all put together!

Brand new cover design for Dreamer

Posted on October 26, 2014 by Emi T

Click to enlarge

After long hours of fine tuning, slight adjustments and giving myself eye-strain, I’m proud to announce that the cover for Dreamer is finally finished!!  This is not only the brightest cover in the Clockwork Twist series so far, but it was also the damn fiddliest.  Still, in the end, I’m quite happy with it.

This book is a much brighter book than Trick and many of the other books, for content as well.  I’m currently writing the 8th book, and re-touching all the others in between but whenever I think back to Dreamer, I always end up smiling.  While it has it’s surprises and dangers, there are so many funny moments, and such a great sense of comfort and wonder about it, that it still remains one of my all time favorite books in the whole series.  Book five is really fun too…  And four!  Oh, Twist, I’m so sorry for book four.  Then, there’s six and seven…

Anyway! I decided to show that brightness in the cover of Dreamer as well.  There is also (not really spoilers, I swear) a Native-American village that floats on a cloud, and a brand new character who has other people’s dreams whenever he falls asleep.  Having two different tribes in my own family background, I grew up with a  Cherokee-style dream-catcher always near the bed.  Naturally, the elements of this story brought that image to mind.

Full back, spine and front cover. Click to enlarge

Of course, there are many different styles and corresponding meanings (or lack of meaning) attributed to each part of a dream-catcher, depending on it’s origin and the myths attached to it in different cultures.  For this reason, I did my best not to be too true to any one style.  My book is fiction anyway, so I didn’t want to make anything that might offend someone.  I simply replicated the general symbol that I remembered from my childhood and added the necessary beads, open center point, and feathers, while also matching the clock design that is on the cover of all of my books.  Naturally, I had to add some gears as well.  This is a steampunk book, after all.

So, what do you think?  Let me know how you like my new cover, in a comment down below.  I’m always looking to good feedback.  And also, don’t forget to enter to win a free copy of Dreamer before Twist’s birthday on the 17th!  The details of the contest are right here.  For the next three weeks, I’ll be posting free preview chapters of Dreamer here on my blog, as well, so stay tuned!

Posted in Twisty things Tagged artwork, book cover design, Clockwork Twist, CWTwist, dream-catcher, dreamer, ebook, Emily Thompson, neo-Victorian, self publishing, steampunk, victoriana Leave a comment

!!Fan art and photo contest!!

Posted on October 19, 2014 by Emi T

As some of you may remember, November 17th is Twist’s birthday!  Or, the day I started writing the series, anyway.  It was on that fateful night, fours years ago, that I wrote Twist’s name for the first time, and did the first draft on the first chapter of Waking.  Ah, so much nostalgia built up over 4 short years…  To commemorate such a significant night, this year I’m holding a contest!

There will be two categories: Fan Art, and Cake Photo.

Option 1, Fan Art Category:

Any form of fan art is acceptable, be it drawing, photo-collage, sculpture, or even *ahem* fan-fiction… (glances to the side innocently like she’s never heard of slash fiction)  Since this is for Twist’s birthday, anything party themed would be great, but it’s really all up to you.  Use your imagination!  Note: if you happen to be a baker, and want to submit a photo of an original piece of pastry, be sure to mention that it’s not just a found photo in your post.

Prize:

A signed paperback copy of the band new Book Three: Dreamer!  I’ll contact the winner later for mailing info.  All submissions and their artists, winning or otherwise, will also be featured on this site and all of Twist social media!

Option 2, Cake Photo Category:

Send me photos of steampunk birthday cakes!  This one is super easy.  It doesn’t have to be your own cake or photo, so please do reference the original artist/photographer/baker/source in your post just to be polite.  Simply find any photos of steampunk cakes, cupcakes, cakes shaped like pocket watches or top hats, or anything at all that reminds you of our dear Twist.  And, if possible, try to find an image that no one else has already submitted.  Also, feel free to submit as many times as you like!

Prize:

A free eBook copy (in the format or your choice) of Book Three: Dreamer!

To Enter for either Fan Art or Cake Photo:

Submit your work/photo using #HappyBirthdayTwist on either Facebook, Twitter, or Tumblr, from now until the 17th of November.  I’ll re-tweet, share, and re-blog everything as I find them, as well.  I will search and collect all submissions on the 18th, and the winner will be announced on the following Sunday, the 23rd.  Be sure to use the hashtag, so I can find your substitutions.

It’s that easy!   No fuss, no muss.  I’ll choose the winners in each category based strictly on feels, so anyone can win.  If you have any questions about the contest, feel free to ask in a comment on this post, but as I said above, please only submit your entries on social media, using #HappyBirthdayTwist

I can’t WAIT to see what you all come up with!

It’s finally getting to the good part of the year!

Posted on October 5, 2014 by Emi T

Song of the South (1946) Gif from “Raiders of the Lost Tumblr.” randar.com

Hello lovelies, and hello October!  Let’s all go out and frolic in the leaves for the rest of the day.  What do you say?  No leaves where you are because California is being hot and crappy, or you’re in the southern hemisphere?  No matter.  There’s always pumpkin spice lattes and gifs.

But autumn doesn’t just mean it’s time for cooler weather, gorgeous grey skies and drizzle, and finally getting your scarf collection out of hiding.  It also means that November is just around the corner and there’s loads of Twist goodies soon to come!  First and foremost,

Clockwork Twist, Book Three: Dreamer
will be released on Nov 17th!

The book is going through final edits right now, the cover is … well, mostly done-ish, and the first preview chapters will be up on this site very soon!  There will also be 3 different giveaways, a free eBook day, and other lovely treats to come.  Here’s a brief schedule of what to expect:

  • Oct 1st-31st: Goodread giveaway for a signed copy of Waking.
  • Nov 1st-30th: Goodread giveaway for a signed set of both Waking and Trick.
  • Nov 2nd: The first preview chapter of Dreamer will post here on this site.
  • Nov 9th: The second preview chapter of Dreamer will post.
  • Nov 16th: The third preview chapter of Dreamer will post.
  • Nov 17th: Dreamer release!
    • Waking and Trick eBooks will be free all day on Smashwords.com!
    • Twist’s birthday blog party!
  • Dec 1st-31st: Goodread giveaway for a signed set of all three, Waking, Trick, and Dreamer!

I’ll also be putting up cover art (when I finish it…) and a few other surprise treats as well.  I’m not sure just now when all the other things I have in store for you will appear, so you’ll just have to keep an eye on this blog, or my other social medias.  But, the first treat is up right now!

Writer Positivity, because we all need it sometimes.

Posted on September 28, 2014 by Emi T

Hello lovelies.  I assume that many of you are writers, or thinking about writing.  You know I am.  And while I usually have a wonderful time writing, and I deeply enjoy working out the character interactions, and the scenes, and the setting, and all of the tiny little details, it’s not always sunshine and daffodils.  Nothing is life ever is, after all.

I found this wonderful set of positive writerly thoughts on Tumblr and thought I’d give them a share.  Click any of the images to visit the original blog.  I found the combos thanks to bookworm-goddess, who also has a great Tumblr.  I highly recommend following them both.  Enjoy!

Ahhh….  Don’t you just want to grab your laptop and go spend the rest of the day in your own book?  I do!

Which nugget of inspiration was your favorite?  Which one made your skin all prickly with excitement?  Let me know in a comment!  I’d love to know.

Thanks again to Bookworm-Goddess and Max Kirin!  If you’ve got a Tumblr, be sure to follow them both.

How to cheat at social media-ing, Episode: Tumblr Queue and IFTTT

Posted on September 21, 2014 by Emi T

Image taken from thegoodvybe’s Tumblr feed

I’m lazy.  I’m much rather spend time writing, reading, watching Supernatural all over again on Netflix, or assassinating people in Renaissance Italy (hello, PS3 game reference!) than do anything that feels like work.  And unless I need Tumblr therapy after a particularly heart-wrenching season finally, or I’m glued to Twitter praying in vain for a YES vote for Scotland’s indyref debate, social media always feel like work to me.  I know that many people count Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr, Instagram, and all the others as fun-time, I just don’t.  I use them too, but I get board really easy.  However, as an indie author, it’s professional suicide to not build a following everywhere I can to help promote my books.

So, whether you’re like me and can’t be bothered to spend hours trying to gain followers on 10 different sites, or you just don’t have the time or know-how required, here are two tricks that I’ve used to save my sanity.

First, the power of the Tumblr Queue:  

If you’re over 25, there’s only a slight chance that you have a Tumblr account or use it often.  But let me tell you, the fan-girls/boys of Tumblr are a mighty force.  More than that, Tumblr can be bent to the will of the time-challenges with just a few easy steps.  First of all, when you create a new post or re-blog, there are always 5 option to chose from, under the little arrow on the right of he blue button: 1 Post Now, 2 Add to queue, 3 Schedule, 4 Save as draft, and 5 Post privately.  Using the 1st option, your post will appear immediately.  But the true power of Tumblr comes from the 2nd and 3rd options.

If you decide to Queue your post, it will sit in a holding area, waiting to be automatically posted.  Once you queue something, you can then click on “Queue” on the right side of your Tumblr dashboard, and find setting on how often your account will auto-post your queued posts.  You can choose a range of time each day, and how many posts will appear each day.  Then, they will appear on their own, without you having to do another living thing.  The only thing to watch out for is the hashtags, which annoying re-set when you re-blog.  Just be sure to add them back in.

I’ve found that by spending 1 hard-core searching and re-blogging session, I amassed over 100 posts in my queue.  Now, I could have immediately re-blogged everything, but then my Tumblr feed would have been a huge spam-fest, and then silent.  Instead, the topical posts I found will appear in reasonable fashion, making it look as if my feed might be nice to follow…

Second, the might and magic of IFTTT: 

So ok, now your Tumblr is running like a top, and people are starting to follow you there.  But you haven’t touched your Twitter for months and your Facebook is boring as heck.  Never fear, IFTTT is here!  IFTTT = If This Then That.

This magical site is one of the most powerful tools I’ve ever seen on-line.  Using this tool, you can silently link all sorts of things that don’t normally go together.  Wish your phone would alert you when there’s a rain warning in your area?  Want to get a text message every time the ISS flies overhead?  Want to make it so that all of your blogs post the same thing simultaneously without you having to lift a finger?  IFTTT can do that!  Just get yourself a free account, hook up all your accounts, and presto!  You’re suddenly a social media ninja.

My favorite tools to use are A) 500px-to-Tumblr-Drafts, B) WeHeartIt-hearted-images-to-Tumblr-drafts, C) Tumblr-image-post-to-Twitter-native-image-post, and D) Tumblr-to-Facebook.  A auto searches the site 500px for images tagged with my terms, and then dump them into my Tumblr Drafts folder so that I can curate them and add the ones I like to mt queue.  B automatically adds every image I heart on WeHeartIt to my Tumblr Drafts folder too.  Using these two tools, my queue grew from 100 to 300 in a week.

C fixes that nasty annoying thing that Twitter does when you share an image from another site.  If I just clicked the share button from Tumblr, my Twitter would only post a link, and not a full image.  Since this is a problem, anyone who does post full pictures gets a lot more attention on Twitter, so it’s nice to have them show up.  With this tool, I don’t even have to click share.  Any image that is posted on my Tumblr feed is automatically posted as a full image on my Twitter.  Now, my Twitter looks awesome, and I still hardly actually go there to use it.  D does the same thing as C, but with Facebook, so that my Facebook page feed gets love too, even when I hardly go there either.

The up-shot:

And why, you might ask, would it be worth all this set up to just get some pretty pictures up on my sites all the time?  Because, my books are steampunk, and steampunk fans are visual people.  If I want their attention, I’d better have lots of shiny pocket watches, battling airships, and the like to offer.  If your fans are more literary, then re-blog quotes and articles.  If your fans are romance junkies, then there’s plenty of provocative imagery and info on other romance books to share.  The point is, that once your feeds have nice things, and people searching for related tags find you, and start sharing you, their friends will follow you too, and their friends, and your fan base will only get bigger and bigger.

Wouldn’t you rather have hundreds and thousands of people already paying attention to your Twitter, Facebook, and even your Tumblr when you have something important to announce about the project you’re selling?  Doing this is the easiest way I’ve ever found to do just that, without having to spend time doing it all by hand.  My followers has already grown by 30% in the last few weeks alone.  My Tumblr queue is sitting pretty at over 300 posts ready to post, 3 a day, across three sites, for over 3 months solid.  In the coming months, I expect my followers to only grow faster and faster.

So, if you think that this sort of trick would improve your internet life, then give it a shot!  Share this post to anyone else you know who is in need of a quick fan-base, or just wants to build on what they already have.  And if you try it, please let me know how it works for you!  All I know is how it works for me, which is simply splendid.

And of course, follow me on the social media site of your choice.     

Posted in indie publishing, Uncategorized Tagged build a following, Clockwork Twist, Emily Thompson, how to use ifttt, ifttt, self publishing, sharing images, social media, steampunk, tumblr, twitter Leave a comment
